intro: Portulaca africana, commonly known as African moss rose, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a low-growing annual herb with fleshy, succulent stems and leaves that are typically oval or egg-shaped. The plant produces vibrant, showy flowers that range in color from pink to red, often resembling roses. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and containers. Its ability to store water in its leaves allows it to survive in arid conditions.
